page.title: 15THE FIVE PARISHES
page.content: This area covers part of (1) North Hertfordshire & a tiny bit of (2) Cambridgeshire. In (1),Therfield parish covers 71%, Kelshall 12%, Royston 9%,Reed 6%.THERFIELD = about half the houses, most of the amenities, some outlying farms & farmland, the racing stables & one third of Therfield Heath.KELSHALL = 4 houses, the rest, farmland.ROYSTON = the hospital,a new housing estate a few other houses,but mostly farmland,all once in Therfield Parish.REED = a narrow strip adjoining A.10 road,all farmland & 1 disused windmill.In (2),LITLINGTON 2% = all farmland. There are no rivers or surface water areas. In the village are some springs which run South. Many small ponds have been drained. The 2 deepest wells are- Old Rectory,500ft. & Greys Farm,350ft.
